title: At Least Two Tornadoes Rip Through North-Central Illinois
teaser: Rescue workers are still searching through the rubble. At least two people were killed and hundreds were displaced.
contentencoded:
Rescue workers are still searching through the rubble today in north-central Illinois, after at least two tornadoes touched down last night and ripped through six different counties. At least two people wereÂ killed and hundreds were displaced.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson gets the latest from WNIJ’s Jenna Dooley in DeKalb, Illinois.

Guest

  • Jenna Dooley, reporter and host at WNIJ, Northern Public Radio, in DeKalb, Illinois. She tweets @DooleyJenna.
